content.question: A curve in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane is defined by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals, e raised to the 2 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, e raised to the negative 2 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is an expression for <math alttext="the derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><mi>x</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative of e raised to the negative 4 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the negative of e raised to the 4 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="e raised to the negative 4 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="e raised to the 4 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the negative of e raised to the negative 4 t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.1: (BC ONLY) Defining and Differentiating Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Identify how mathematical characteristics or properties of functions are related in different representations.
